page.title: 05MARSH AND HARBOUR
page.content: The increasing use of Wells Harbour is threatened by silting. The main cause of this silting is a reduction in the flow of water past the quay and in the main channel on the ebb tide. The flow comes from the many creeks of the marsh which fill on the flood tide. Recently the incoming tide has eroded two channels which lead directly to the marsh area GR.9244. As a consequence on the ebb much less water flows past the quay and down the main channel and fails to scour out the silt. In 1985 a project by the Harbour Commissioners and the Manpower Services commission is blocking off these two bypaSS channels and forcing all the water to enter and, more importantly, leave past the quay and down the main channel route.
